search_information.query_displayed: The Effect of Language Background on Achievement Level and Learning among Elementary School Students. Rosenthal, Alvin S. And Others Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: The effect of language background on achievement level and learning among elementary school students
organic_results.snippet: The current study used a nationally representative sample of elementary school students to investigate the effect of language and other home background on achievement level and learning for both reading and math. Results show that socioeconomic status and race/ethnicity variables were more important than language in explaining low achievement among language-minority students. Spanish-language background was more strongly related to reading than to math achievement deficits. The language effect was also much …

publication_info.summary: AS Rosenthal, K Baker, A Ginsburg - Sociology of Education, 1983 - JSTOR
